definitions.definition: To yield or suffer ; to surrender ; to grant
examples: I have to concede the argument.
He conceded the race once it was clear he could not win.
Kendall conceded defeat once she realized she could not win in a battle of wits.

definitions.definition: To grant , as a right or privilege ; to make concession of.
To admit or agree to be true ; to acknowledge
To have a goal or point scored against
examples: I don't know how they conceded that goal; their defense was so solid.

definitions.definition: to have runs scored off of one's bowling.

main_definition: To yield or suffer ; to surrender ; to grant
secondary_definitions: To grant , as a right or privilege ; to make concession of.
To admit or agree to be true ; to acknowledge
( sports ) To have a goal or point scored against
( cricket ) (of a bowler ) to have runs scored off of one's bowling.
